selected_quotes: #Scooters are a leading cause of childhood #injury.
Foot-powered scooters accounted for more than 40% of toy-related hospital admissions since 1990.
How many toy-related injuries to children are there annually in the US?
New study investigates toy-related injuries among children: Just in time for the holiday season!

citation.abstract: This study investigates the epidemiology of injuries associated with toys among US children by analyzing data from the National Electronic Injury Surveillance System. During 1990-2011, an estimated 3 278 073 (95% confidence interval = 2 762 281-3 793 865) children <18 years old were treated in US emergency departments for toy-related injuries, averaging 149 003 cases annually. The annual injury rate per 10 000 children increased significantly by 39.9% from 18.88 in 1990 to 26.42 in 2011. The number and rate of injuries peaked at age 2 years; 63.4% of patients were male; and 80.3% of injuries occurred at home. Ride-on toys accounted for 34.9% of injuries and 42.5% of hospital admissions. This study is the first to comprehensively investigate toy-related injuries among children using a nationally representative data set. The increasing number and rate of toy-related injuries to children, especially those associated with ride-on toys, underscore the need for increased efforts to prevent these injuries.
citation.title: Toy-Related Injuries Among Children Treated in US Emergency Departments, 1990-2011
